alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 04 at 7:45PM CDT until October 04 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Rogers County in northeastern Oklahoma... Mayes County in northeastern Oklahoma... Central Wagoner County in northeastern Oklahoma... Northwestern Cherokee County in east central Oklahoma... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 745 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles south of Foyil to 3 miles west of Chouteau to 5 miles south of Inola, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations in or near the path include... Claremore... Wagoner... Pryor... Coweta... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Adair... Hoot Owl... Peggs... Rose... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... Taiwah... Tiawah... Strang... Mazie... Snowdale State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 248 and 262. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
